page.title: 01Glenn Udalain
page.content: The A890 bisects this area. to the east is mainly Conchra Estate with some forestry commission land in the north. To the west is part of Auchtertyre Farm with private afforestation in the north. both forestry areas are planted with conifers. The hills are mainly heather and rough grazing, grazed by sheep and cattle. The river Udalain has a hydro-electric dam at the south which supplies Nost'e power station, part of the National Grid. It also has a stock of brown trout. There are red and roe deer on the hills and wildcat and pine marten in the forest.
